Whether it's a financial donation or just telling a friend, we can't do this without you!
story_txt:
Pictured above:  Lady Pink, LADY OF THE LEAF redux, WT 2013, with children from the El Camino neighborhood. Photo by Jason Wilder for WALL\THERAPY.


UPDATE JULY6, 2015:

THANK YOU ALL FOR YOUR SUPPORT! Thanks to all of you we hit our mark, and we've already installed the first mural by Handiedan at 880 S. Clinton St.!
Because we hit our goal, we are now in "InDemand," which means we can keep accepting donations beyond our deadline! If there was a perk that you thought got away, you may still have a chance to pick it up!
See you July 17!
- Ian, Erich, and the WT crew!

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

What is WALL\THERAPY?




WALL\THERAPY is an art and community intervention project,
using public murals as a means to transform the urban landscape, inspire, and
build community.

What has WALL\THERAPY done so
far?

2500 cans of
spray paint and 300 gallons of paint later, over 60 of the most talented and
recognized artists from the region, the nation, and the world have shared their
talents to create over 100 murals throughout the city of Rochester since this
“Visual Intervention” project began in 2011.
These murals have transformed walls, buildings, and neighborhoods. This transformation has sparked inspiration in individuals and communities alike. The murals have become part of the local
conversation, the local identity, and the fabric of the city. Local art classes and
schools tour the murals as part of the curriculum. Local professionals change
their route to the murals part of their drive home. Local artists, young and
old, find inspiration in the works.
WALL\THERAPY mural
project is now recognized worldwide. People
from 2000+ cities in 104+ countries have visited the WALL\THERAPY site to learn
more. New mural artists from around the world ask about painting
Rochester, for the first time or for another time.
The project has
gained steady media attention, and media coverage has included 100+ articles,
blogs, and videos about the project from a variety of media outlets including
NPR and Huffington Post.
Earlier in 2015,
WALL\THERAPY was selected to partner
with the Google Cultural Institute Street Art Project to insure that all murals
would be accessible through capturing the imagery of the work and through
interactive access via Google Maps. Click to visit out Cultural Institute site, where we have all of our murals archived in high resolution: https://walltherapyny.culturalspot.org
What is happening this year?
WALL\THERAPY and URBAN NATION are excited to launch the International exchange program between Rochester and Berlin this year. Artists curated by the UN Director Yasha Young have been invited to participate and contribute to the program of WALL\THERAPY 2015 curated by Ian Wilson (founder, co-curator) and Erich Lehman (co-curator, lead organizer). WALL\THERAPY 2015 will kick off on July 17, 2015. Our theme for this year is surrealism and the fantastic.

UN Exchange artists 2015 include:Andreas EnglundOnur and Wes21NEVERCREWVextaLi HillHandiedan (joining us in Late June)SellFable City  (Participating in the IMPACT! show)
WT artists 2015 include:DazeJeff SotoMaxx242Nate HodgeEder MunizBrittany WilliamsMatthew Roberts and Joe Guy Allard
Brooklyn Street Art founders Jaime Rojo and Steve Harrington will be contributing with a very exciting special talk on Friday of WALL\THERAPY week.
To start things off right this year, we will be holding our first proper art exhibition kickoff titled IMPACT! This exhibition will take place at 1975 Gallery (89 Charlotte St.) and will showcase artwork from all the 2015 participating WALL\THERAPY artists in support of IMPACT! – IMProving Access to Care by Teleradiology – www.impactrad.org. IMPACT seeks to provide easier access to better care in underdeveloped and underserved regions through cloud-based x-ray services and a network of volunteer radiologists supporting IMPACT sites. Both WALL\THERAPY and IMPACT! are projects of The Synthesis Collaborative.


Why does WALL\THERAPY need your
help?
Making all of this
happen year after year takes a lot. With a core team of 13 members, our 50+ expanded team that makes this project happen are all volunteer, but the materials, equipment, and
artists to make it all happen require financial support. You donations go towards the paint for many
large-scale walls, renting construction lifts to safely access and paint those same
large-scale walls, and the travel expenses, hospitality and a very
modest honorarium for the 15 professional artists that will share their talent
with the project this Summer. 
WALL\THERAPY was created
thanks entirely to financial and volunteer donations from its many supporters. We
are asking again for assistance to continuing this forward momentum, to
continue to bring unique artists to our city to help inspire and to heal. 
Your continued support will allow us to
support the local and international artists as they produce visually compelling
murals in the Rochester cityscape, in turn improving and strengthening our
thriving community. 

___________________________________________________

What your donation means directly to the cause: 
For every $15 you donate, we can provide an artist with about 3 cans of spray paint. 
For every $25 you donate the money goes for 4-5 cans of spray paint or a gallon bucket of primer 
For every $50 that means we can purchase paint brushes, rollers, buckets and cover other supply expenses. 
Donations of $150 or more helps the team supply the artist with food and water as they paint their murals.
Donations of $500 or more helps us rent a mechanical lift for the week, and our artists don’t have to stand precariously on a ladder to paint their work.
Should you donate $1000, that money goes directly to plane tickets and any sort of car rental needed for the artists
If you donate $5000, you are not just solidifying WALL\THERAPY this year and becoming a producer of this event, but you will be instrumental in helping us start focusing on the humanitarian endeavor and sister initiative known as IMPACT! 

___________________________________________________

THE PERKS
This year, we have been so fortunate to have many of our previous participants offer artwork and prints from their own private stock to help us reach out goal. We've got a few more on the way (we can only load 20 at a time), but don't delay, as we only have as few as one of some of these perks!




WALL\THERAPY "TOOLS OF THE TRADE" Market Bag - $25Since the beginning, WALL\THERAPY has been rooted in/near Rochester’s Public Market. So we’re bringing you this sturdy tote to carry around paint supplies, fresh vegetables, or whatever else you can fit!  (Mockup shown)(Made to order)


WALL\THERAPY "OG logo" T-shirt - $25The classic shirt is back! Two color print (white and blue) of the WALL\THERAPY logo on premium cotton t-shirt. Will be printed to order and available after the end of the fundraiser.(open edition)



WALL\THERAPY "TOOLS OF THE TRADE" shirt - $30New for this year, we bring two-sided "Tools of the Trade" design on a white premium cotton tshirt with a two-sided, two-color print (black and blue) with the WALL\THERAPY logo on the front and a graphic listing of the tools of our craft on the back. Available in Men's and Women's sizes. We will follow up after the fundraiser ends to get your shirt size.(Made to order, Mockup shown above)





WALL\THERAPY "TOOLS OF THE TRADE" letterpress print - $50
Featuring a graphic listing of the tools of our craft, the 20" x 10.5" letterpress print features silver ink on top of blue spray paint so each one is unique. Hand-sprayed by members of the WT team and letterpress printed by our friends at Pistachio Press, this signed/numbered print has a total edition of 100 on 100# Midnight Black Strathmore Premium Cambric paper, with 50 available through this fundraiser. Image size is 18.5" x 9" with a 1/2" border that enables easy matting and framing.(Actual shown)(50 available)



Mike Ming  "Dirty Devil in Rochester" screenprint - $100Our 2013 muralist Mike Ming has donated this edition of 6 screen prints. Each one of these single-colored prints is unique. Signed & Numbered. 18"x24" on heavyweight watercolor paper.(6 Available)  (Please contact us if interested, we are currently at our max perks.)




Omen "There Was a Time" Etching - $100Our Northern neighbor OMEN donated 10 of his etchings entitled "There Was A Time."  stamped and embossed on heavyweight stock. Signed/Numbered  by the artist,  9.5 x 4.125” 

In Omen’s own words: “Classy, Subtle, Zombies.”
(10 available)





Peeta "UnReliable" print - $200Donated by our friends at 1xRun, this gorgeous print is by our 2014 WRITES OF SPRING muralist and longtime friend Peeta. 20 x 15 Inches Archival Pigment Print on 310gsm Bright White Fine Art Paper
(1 available)


John Perry "Flavor Flav" - $250Original artwork by 2014 Rochester muralist John Perry! John has donated a portrait of one of his early influences, Flavor Flav. Acrylic on wood, 15.5" x 24" x 1.75"

RANGE "Anonymous" Artwork - $300A true Rochester Legend, RANGE FUA has donated an original artwork - acrylic and Airbrush on a NYC MTA map. Will ship folded. 23.75 x 32.25”unfolded size. Range painted with us during July 2013 and his mural can be found on the El Camino Trail.(1 Available)

Using float-mounted, reclaimed skateboards ridden in Rochester, these 17" birch panel pieces were given the rest of the Sweet Meat Co (all previous muralists) to customize just for this fundraiser. Addison Karl: Hands artwork - $350Original Artwork by Addison Karl entitled "Hands", 2014, Pen & Ink on white 190g/m2, 16.53 x 11.69" (A3) size matt paper. Addision's July 2014 mural can be seen gracing the Eastern side of the Fedder Industrial Complex, towering 4 stories as our largest mural to date!(1 Available,  please contact us if interested.)



LNY Original Artwork - $400LNY's "Bolivia 1967" - Original artwork, acrylic on double sided matte Dura-Lar film, Signed and Dated, 2015. Donated by the artist. 14" x 17"

LNY joined us in July of 2013 and left a striking mural on the corner of Avenue D and Joseph Ave, entitled "I AM, YO SOY," depicting a young boy who lives in the building, Trayvon Martin, and both young and older versions of Frederick Douglass to remind us of the potential we have inside us all.(1 available)

Know Hope - The Letting Go - Photographic Print - $11002013 muralist KNOW HOPE has donated one of his photographic prints from an edition of 5, of his Rochester mural "The Letting Go," from his recent Truth and Method exhibition in Tel Aviv, Israel. It is 27.5" x 19.5" (70x50cm) and will be framed.

For companies or benefactors interested in playing a larger role in the success of WALL\THERAPY:
SPONSOR  - $1000Donors at the SPONSOR level will  have their name/company logo added to the WALL\THERAPY website, receive a copy of each of the WALL\THERAPY, die-cut logo stickers, a WALL\THEARPY t-shirt featuring the logo, and tickets for two to join us at our wrap-up dinner in July.(10 Available)

SPONSOR A WALL - $5000New this year, we are offering the opportunity to support the creation of one of the murals directly. We will place a signpost at the wall stating your sponsorship, you will receive acknowledgements on our site and you will be listed as patron in the mural's forthcoming entry into our Google Cultural Institute site. You will receive a framed  11x17" photo print of the finished mural, and a small original by the artist courtesy of WALL\THERAPY. We will make sure you are adorned with a complement of WALL\THERAPY gear.(2 available)

SOLD OUT PERKS!

Rochester Sticker Pack - $25Each pack includes a minimum of 1 sticker from the following Rochester Graffiti writers and Street Artists curated by The Lobby (@Lobbyist): THIEVIN' STEPHEN (2012 and 2013 muralist), CHANGEROUS 63 (2013 muralist), RANGE FUA (2013 muralist), BONES FUA (2014 muralist), Spaceman, Ax, Yews HFK, Frank Bacon, Shootyerface, Downer, Nova FUA, FUA Krew, and others!

WALL\THERAPY Brass bracelet - $40A custom made, solid brass bracelet with WALL THERAPY and ROC punched into each side to show your Rochester pride. Custom made by Rochester's own Interstellar Love Craft at her home base in The Yards, our own home base during WALL\THERAPY week. ( 10 available)



Icy & Sot FLOWER POWER tshirt - $35We have teamed up with Icy and Sot to produce an open edition of dark gray t-shirts featuring the FLOWER POWER artwork they painted at 50 Anderson Ave during October of 2013.  The artwork will be on the front with a WALL\THERAPY logo on the back of the neck. Sizes from Women's Small to Men's XXXL. These will only be available to order through this year's fundraiser. We will follow up after the fundraiser ends to get your shirt size.(Made to order, only available through this fundraiser)


Icy & Sot FLOWER POWER Hoodie - $50We have teamed up with artist brother duo Icy and Sot to produce a limited run of 30 black hooded pullover Sweatshirts featuring the FLOWER POWER artwork they painted at 50 Anderson Ave during October of 2013 on the back and a WALL\THERAPY logo on the front left chest. 
Sizes from Women's Small to Men's XXL are available on a first come, first serve basis to the first 30 supporters and will be printed according to your size. We will follow up after the fundraiser ends to get your sweatshirt size.(Only 30 available through this fundraiser)

Above FUNNY FARM print - $100ABOVE joined us in August 2014 to adorn a wall with his DIAMONDS mural just on the edge of the Rochester Public Market off Railroad St.  5 of these prints were donated by the artist himself from his sold out 1xRun edition.  Giclee on 310gsm Fine Art Paper, Signed & Numbered. Sam Rodriguez "Hybrid Vision" Print - $125"Hybrid Vision" Print - Donated by ourJuly 2014 artist Sam Rodriguez, this print comes from a limited edition of 25 fine art giclee prints on 100% archival velvet fine art paper. Includes embossed Certificate of Authenticity. It is the first in his series of "TYPE FACES" prints.(2 Available, both sold out)

35 years of Shoe print - $175Our 2014 WRITES OF SPRING muralist Niels "Shoe" Meulman has donated one of his "35 Years of Shoe" prints to the cause! story:
The Purpose

My name is Kathryn Lee Steele, better known as KLSteeleArt around the online community, and I am a digital artist. Over the last few years I have had the opportunity to work for some amazing clients such as Paizo Publishing, ActionPhase Games, and Kobold Press, along with other freelance opportunities. You may have seen me at such conventions as Indiana Comic Con, Indy Pop Con, Gen Con, Youmacon, and Acen, to name a few. 

Atelier: A Book of Characters is about more that just sharing a few pretty pictures. It is about sharing the knowledge I have gained as an artist and what inspires me with the public. Every artist is unique in their processes and what makes them create. Atelier: A Book of Characters is exactly that - my processes and what makes me create.


This campaign is to help me print a limited number of the art book. I can't do this on my own as it is costly to run a larger volume of self printed books. So I am reaching out to my fans, art community supporters, and lovers of all things creative and educational.

Pledging to this campaign will help me print off enough books in time for this years Gen Con convention, and best of all you can get your own copy (and one of the first in order) by pledging.

Why is it so special to pledge now and not buy later? This campaign directly affects the number of books I can print. Each book will be numbered out of the volume count which means if 50 people pledge for a book and you are one of those pledgers, your book will be numbered within that 50 count. Each book will also be signed by me.

But wait, what is in the book?

The book will house several different aspects of my art. Besides full color print work, some of the pieces will also detail my creative process and what inspire the piece - giving you a more in depth analysis of the story behind the art.


(All Pathfinder art is (c)Copyright Paizo Publishing 2014-15)

I am also including several of my sketches from the finished pieces and some not finished - showing you where it all began, a doodle.

TUTORIALS & STEPxSTEPS

In Atelier, will be some tutorials walking you through my creative process and giving you some tips on how to create similar pieces. I am also including with selected pieces to show the step by steps of the piece so you can see where it began to where it finished up.


What Comes in The Book?

  • Number and Signed front page
  • 30-40 pages of full-color art
  • 2-4 Tutorial walkthroughs
  • Several pages dedicate to sketch work
  • Insight on inspiration, techniques, and processes.

Why make an art book?

This book represents the accumulation of love and support I have gained over the years from my family and friends, and from the community. It is my way of sharing with others what I love and have a deep passion for, and hopefully inspiring others to make the jump into their passions as well.

What You Get


ADD-ONS

You can add on items to your pledge!
  • 11x17 Print - $15
  • 2x 11x17 Prints - $25

Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges of trying to make it as a professional artist are plenty. It takes a lot of dedication and determination. My career has taken me down many avenues and not only do I work a full time job as a Media Specialist, but I teach post-secondary college, and freelance. Now that I am off for summer break, this is the perfect time to release this book, but without support from people like you it will not happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to pledge, you can help by spreading the word. Share this campaign on social media, with friends and family, or anyone else who may be interested! It's easy by using the IndieGoGo share tools.

Questions & Answers

Q: Why is the book $40?
A: The book cost covers the amount for printing, shipping, and the time taken to put the book together. 

Q: How large is the book?
A: The book is 8.5x11 inches.

Q: How long after the campaign ends will I receive my copy of the book?
A: The campaign will end early July, but printing and shipping will take approximately 2 weeks. Shipping for the books will go out early August or you can request to pick up for copy at Gen Con if you know you will be in town at the convention.

Q: How many books will be printed since it is limited quantity?
A: The number of books printed depends on how much the campaign raises. My goal is to print 100 though.

Q: Will there be any tutorials in this book?
A: Yes! I am planning on putting in about 2-3 tutorials covering various aspects of digital painting.

Q: Why is the 2 book copy option available at 80$ instead of 100$ since it is double the price?
A: Because the book is supposed to be limited numbers, I am trying to keep that option limited itself.

Q: How many pages are in the book?
A: I am estimating between 40-60 pages. I am leaving the room open in case there is anything I may want to add or if there is something that does not work, and for formatting reasons.

Q: What art will be in the book?
A: A lot of the art is from the past 2 years, though some of the sketches are between the last 4 years.

Q: Will we get to select which print we want with our reward tier?
A: Yes; when the campaign ends I will send out a notice with different print options to choose from.

Q: Will I be able to buy the book in stores?
A: No. You have to get the book directly from me at this time. After Gen Con, if I have any remaining between the convention and campaign, I will put them up for sale on my website.

Q: Why are you asking for $1200?
A: The goal is to print at least 100 copies of the book which will cost around 1k. The other $200 is to cover shipping charges and miscellaneous other fees.


Have a question? Ask in the comments section and we will add it to the list!

Pledging to this campaign will help me print off enough books in time for this years Gen Con convention, and best of all you can get your own copy (and one of the first in order) by pledging.
Why is it so special to pledge now and not buy later? This campaign directly affects the number of books I can print. Each book will be numbered out of the volume count which means if 50 people pledge for a book and you are one of those pledgers, your book will be numbered within that 50 count. Each book will also be signed by me.


But wait, what is in the book?
The book will house several different aspects of my art. Besides full color print work, some of the pieces will also detail my creative process and what inspire the piece - giving you a more in depth analysis of the story behind the art.







(All Pathfinder art is (c)Copyright Paizo Publishing 2014-15)

I am also including several of my sketches from the finished pieces and some not finished - showing you where it all began, a doodle.

TUTORIALS & STEPxSTEPS
In Atelier, will be some tutorials walking you through my creative process and giving you some tips on how to create similar pieces. I am also including with selected pieces to show the step by steps of the piece so you can see where it began to where it finished up.




What Comes in The Book?

Number and Signed front page
30-40 pages of full-color art
2-4 Tutorial walkthroughs
Several pages dedicate to sketch work
Insight on inspiration, techniques, and processes.


Why make an art book?
This book represents the accumulation of love and support I have gained over the years from my family and friends, and from the community. It is my way of sharing with others what I love and have a deep passion for, and hopefully inspiring others to make the jump into their passions as well.

What You Get

  






 
ADD-ONS
You can add on items to your pledge!


11x17 Print - $15
2x 11x17 Prints - $25


    Risks & Challenges  The risks and challenges of trying to make it as a professional artist are plenty. It takes a lot of dedication and determination. My career has taken me down many avenues and not only do I work a full time job as a Media Specialist, but I teach post-secondary college, and freelance. Now that I am off for summer break, this is the perfect time to release this book, but without support from people like you it will not happen.   Other Ways You Can Help Even if you are unable to pledge, you can help by spreading the word. Share this campaign on social media, with friends and family, or anyone else who may be interested! It's easy by using the IndieGoGo share tools.
Questions & Answers
Q: Why is the book $40?A: The book cost covers the amount for printing, shipping, and the time taken to put the book together. 
Q: How large is the book?A: The book is 8.5x11 inches.
Q: How long after the campaign ends will I receive my copy of the book?A: The campaign will end early July, but printing and shipping will take approximately 2 weeks. Shipping for the books will go out early August or you can request to pick up for copy at Gen Con if you know you will be in town at the convention.
Q: How many books will be printed since it is limited quantity?A: The number of books printed depends on how much the campaign raises. My goal is to print 100 though.
Q: Will there be any tutorials in this book?A: Yes! I am planning on putting in about 2-3 tutorials covering various aspects of digital painting.
Q: Why is the 2 book copy option available at 80$ instead of 100$ since it is double the price?A: Because the book is supposed to be limited numbers, I am trying to keep that option limited itself.
Q: How many pages are in the book?A: I am estimating between 40-60 pages. I am leaving the room open in case there is anything I may want to add or if there is something that does not work, and for formatting reasons.
Q: What art will be in the book?A: A lot of the art is from the past 2 years, though some of the sketches are between the last 4 years.
Q: Will we get to select which print we want with our reward tier?A: Yes; when the campaign ends I will send out a notice with different print options to choose from.
Q: Will I be able to buy the book in stores?A: No. You have to get the book directly from me at this time. After Gen Con, if I have any remaining between the convention and campaign, I will put them up for sale on my website.
Q: Why are you asking for $1200?A: The goal is to print at least 100 copies of the book which will cost around 1k. The other $200 is to cover shipping charges and miscellaneous other fees.
Have a question? Ask in the comments section and we will add it to the list!

story:
In a Coconut Shell... 

I am the proud new owner of a 1991 Coleman Roanoke Pop Up Camper. This beauty needs some spunk and pizzazz to make her a comfy tropical home for me and my two pups, Brix and Captain. Help me recover funds from her purchase, and I will furnish, modify, and decorate my new home ENTIRELY with found marine debris from Biscayne National Park, as well as free recycled items I find along the way! 

About The Dough:

I need $1500 bucks to recover the money I spent on purchasing and registering SeaSquirt. Recovering this money will allow me to turn her into a truly comfortable (yet tiny!) home for myself and my two pups (and to continue eating!). If you can help me, I promise to entirely makeover and furnish my camper with recycled items. I will not buy anything or use anything new in this adventure... everything will come repurposed and recycled, and most of what I use will come from marine debris found on upper keys in Biscayne National Park, where I work as a biologist. 
I'll also use this project as a way to raise awareness about ocean trash and my favorite environmental mission... reusing old stuff! 

But Why???

As a biologist at Biscayne National Park, I spend lots of my time walking the beaches of Elliot Key and nearby islands monitoring sea turtle nesting and removing marine debris as a way to protect nesting mothers and hatchlings. It is unbelievable how much trash accumulates on a yearly basis. An incredibly variety of things new, old, foreign, local, familiar, and mysterious can be found, captured by the roots of the mangroves which built the islands. Most importantly, so much of the stuff that floats up still has functionality. It's not uncommon to find building materials, scuba gear, household items (found some new, unopened dish soap last week!), cool decorations like lobster trap buoys, and everything else imaginable. 

I've seen so much of this trash, that I'm challenging myself to furnish an entire (tiny) home with these items. Not only will it help in removing debris from these islands, but it can encourage others to do the same. Giving old and found stuff a new purpose not only keeps the offending trash off the streets, it prevents the need to buy new. 

Living in a Camper?

I've always loved the idea of having my own little mobile home. I like the sense of freedom, adventure, and simplicity, plus the challenge of downsizing enough to be comfortable with whatever fits in SeaSquirt. I know it won't work forever, but for the next few months, I will live in my tiny camper, surrounded by my found treasures, and be as close as possible to the beautiful park I have loved and worked in for the past year and a half. 

Want to Help? 

Recovering costs from SeaSquirt's purchase will really get my project going, but any contribution can help me towards my goal, including ideas and inspiration! 

  • Have space-saving or decorating tips for tiny homes? 
  • Have you found anything old and useful that could use a new purpose?
  • Can you share my project with friends and family??? 

Thanks so much for your interest and support!!! I'll keep everyone updated with pictures and videos along the way... 

#seasquirtcamper

Instagram: @exploringtheuniverse

Youtube: @meganmarydavenport

story:
My name is Bailey.

Also known as HELLO BAiLEY in the music world.
It has been a dream of mine for as long as I can remember to move to London. Ever since I was in high school I dreamed of being in England, doing what I love.

I've been making music for about eight years now. I've had the opportunity to work with many amazing musicians along the way. Music is what truly makes me happy.
Straight out of high school, I went to school for a few subjects that I enjoyed. But after taking a few classes, I quickly realized I wasn't doing what I love. I knew then that I needed to study something that would get me in the music world.
After lots of dreaming, and realizing I can do anything, I decided in December 2013, that I would turn my dreams into reality. I would go to school in London to study music.
Here I am, months later, accepted into my dream school, in my favorite place in the world, I am planning on leaving my home for the past 22 years in Colorado on September 13th, 2014. Only 6 weeks away! (:
This is definitely not a cheap move, especially on my own. I am currently working two jobs to save up money, but I've recently gotten very sick from all of the hours I'm putting into both jobs.
Something I learned at a young age is to never be afraid to ask for help. You've got nothing to lose. I've managed to save up enough money for my visa, student deposit and half of my plane ticket for September.
So, I'm asking for your help. I want this more than anything, and all I need is a chance to prove what I'm capable of.
My goal is $500. This would allow me to pay for the rest of my plane ticket, go down to one job, and get my health back on track.
I appreciate all of you so much. Thanks for helping me chase my dreams; my happiness. <3

story:
It is said that one of the most important things that you can do *for* your community... is simply... to participate in it.

Wall Therapy is starting back up in Rochester next month. And I was thinking.... Why can't my super fantastic artistic friends and I get together and create our *own* version of Wall therapy! 

Starting with - The Genesee Co-Op Federal Credit Union's Fence!!!! - Chatted with my landlord about it (since he owns that particular building and the parking lot) - And he gave me the Go-Ahead . "As long as it is tasteful and you pay for the paint and supplies, you can do whatever you would like." 

And SO! Here we are - To inspire and to revitalize our little Southwedge with some well needed Art!

My plan is to have an idea and layout by the first week of July. Then on Community Garage Sale Day (July 13th! Hope you've marked your calendars... don't forget, everyone needs a slinky!) - I am hoping that we can get our large group of Family Dinner friends to come over and help paint the Co-Op fence...! It will be fun and easy and you can hang out with your favorite friends!

Obviously - This project is going to take a bit of money to pull off - I would LOVE to replace the entire fence (it is busted and broken). It would cost $300 in supplies and labor. Paint is going to run about $200 - Brushes and supplies will be about $100. And food and refreshments for all the happy painting people will be $100.

Donate $25 you will receive Polaroids of the fence Before/After! - Donate $50 and you get two Polaroids and a Thank You letter signed by all the artists on the team! Donate $150 and you get a 16x22 Red Dress Poster to beautify your own personal space at home! Donate $400 and we can hangout and chat on Skype for an hour and talk about the weather!

Please help us to better our community. If you cannot donate, consider spreading the word! Let's continue to inspire each other by breathing new life and energy to this city

story:
The Burlesque Butcher is performing as part of the Rapid Pulse 2013 International Performance Art Festival!

You can participate by contributing to receive "meat art" perks or just donate to support the project and get mail-able perks

Short Summary

You can read a lot more about the Burlesque Butcher project at her blog: http://burlesquebutcher.wordpress.com/

However...this particular performance takes the Burlesque Butcher's usual home-based events into a more properly "fine art" context. She will be melding her home-butchery advocacy with making several statements about the role of government agencies in regulating what the educated consumer can purchase, gender norms in industries such as meat packing (and those as representative of large societal conditions), and the whole relationship between food and sex.

You can livestream the performance if you can't attend in person at: http://www.livestream.com/dfbrl8r

And details about the timing of the performance on the blog:http://burlesquebutcher.wordpress.com/2013/06/0...

What you are contributing to:

Direct costs for the project include: the purchase of the lamb, plastic aprons, latex gloves, and ice (which is about $600). But hoping very much to be able to pay my co-performers (the lovely Lauren Wessel and Mara May Hem), a photographer, and a videographer (and myself!).

Depending on if you are in town or out of town, you can select different "thank you" perks. Note that if you are selecting the "meat art" perks, you MUST be able to pick up your perk between 7 pm and 10 pm (or thereabouts) on June 3 at Dfbrl8tr gallery.

story:
Hi Everyone,

Thank you so much for taking time to get to know my project better.


THE PROJECT

The interactive installation, “Everybody has a sound”,  transforms the sound of  human movement into light.   Participants will be encouraged to move freely throughout the space with each individual creating their own unique projections which will be layered into projections from others in the space at the same time.  Every movement  will produce frequencies which will  in turn be transformed into light.

Heavy movement produces low tones and light movements produce high tones.

 

Everybody has a sound - Conceptual Diagram:

Without participants the installation is only a shell.

This interactive installation is based on the idea that everybody is just human beings; we are all the same yet we have our own unique sound.

I am creating a space where people can communicate without words, a space that isn’t  disturbed by the noise of the discourses of society. The space is made as an opportunity for the viewer to become a participant in the piece and be a part of a social experiment of communication without words.  

I am creating this space as a counter environment to society, a space with no limits or restrictions. The space is made of mirror, so when the tones are transformed into colors they will be reflected in the rest of the room and fold out like a kaleidoscope. 

The project becomes like walking inside of the body; the participants’ inner perspectives are projected out in colors creating an environment that would become a symphony of interaction.

 

THE BUDGET

The first part of the project, happening in August 2012, is the development of the unique software and testing the visual expression of the project.  For this we need $8,900:camera, computer, projector, hard disc, chapels, test space, speakers and sound system.

For the second part of the project, - building the actual mirrored shell - we need$6,870: covering the 150 sq. meters in mirror, building the wooden shell to hold the mirror, 8 feet x 8 feet video screen.

 

“Everybody has a sound” is an opportunity to see alternatives in interaction and communication and I am eager for participants to share this experience.

The first exhibit will be in Copenhagen, Denmark, but hopefully in time I’ll be able to bring the installation back to New York.

 

FOR MORE INFORMATION

SEE THE WHOLE VIDEO OF THE INSTALLATION:

http://vimeo.com/23098104 (Music to video made by Lovely Liar)

Link to the gallery in Copenhagen, Denmark:

www.peteramby.com

The perks will be send out after the exhibit 

Everybody who wants to participate will be invited to the opening in Copenhagen Denmark (Transportation is not included J)

 

Thanks to Helle Andersen from New School for making the youtube video

story:
A Brand NEW book!

In 2014 and 2016, Indiegogo and Kickstarter helped us raise over $400,000 for our first two books. We're back with a TOTALLY BRAND NEW BOOK filled with more artists, more excitement and more fun! We've been working hard since January 2018, and we hope YOU love it!  

Praise for 21 Draw...

Steve Rude - "An excellent guide from a stunning variety of top-notch artists. You will gain much from its study."

Loopy Dave - "The lineup is fantastic - full of artists who's work I admire. Very excited to be part of this new book!"

Charlie Bowater - "I loved the first book and this one is shaping up to be even better!" 

Lorenzo Etherington - "The new 21 Draw book will delve even deeper than the last in a collection of incredible process tutorials from the world's greatest artists."

Warren Louw - "The lineup of talent in 21 Draw is awesome! "

21 Draw as seen on...

 About the Book... 

Ever since our first book back in 2014, our backers, fans and students have been asking us for a "how-to" book that is focused purely on character design. Our first 2 books touched briefly on the character design process, but this new book is a really deep dive into the art. Character design is such a vast field, which is why it needs it's own focused, indepth book. 

We're working with an amazing line up of incredible industry PROFESSIONALS, and the book is jam-packed full of their combined experience, gained over their long careers. 

 The Goal! 

Our goal is to help YOU be a better artist and have fun at the same time! We want to provide you,  both hobbyists and pros, with a better understanding of the WHOLE character design process. Most importantly, the book gives you the tools you need to produce unique and memorable characters. 

The techniques and tutorials included in the book help build your confidence and strengthen your knowledge of the art of character design, enabling you to successfully design for any project, and most importantly, in any style. And that's why we have such a wide array of artists with varying styles contributing to book! 

This is a book that we have dreamed of making for a long time and it is our biggest project to date. We're making a book that you'll love and cherish for your whole drawing career. YOU will love every page or else you'll get your money back! That's our promise to you.

 

Meet our artists!

LOISH: Lois Van Barrle (AKA Loish) is one of our favourite artists! She's an incredibly talented digital artist with a unique, dream-like style, and you're sure to have seen her work before. Loish has been working with us since 2014 and she always provides amazing work. We're so excited to have her on board again!

 

Tom Bancroft: Tom is a Disney Legend who's been involved in every single project we've done! He's worked on classics like Beauty & the Beast, Lion King & Alladin. His books like "Character Mentor" & others are required reading for many artschools in the world. So cool that he's up for another project :)

 

Loopy Dave: Dave is another superb artist that we've been working with for a long time. He has an instantly recognizable style, and always contributes incredible, unique (and funny!) tutorials.

 

 

Rene Cordova:  Rene is an incredibly talented character designer, art director and illustrator that we're working with for the first time. He's widely known in the industry, with an army of adoring fans! He has so many styles that it's impossible to even describe!

 

 

Gerardo Sandoval:  Gerardo is a kick ass Mexican artist that we've also been working with since 2014. He currently draws for Marvel Comics and other big names. He always provides amazing contributions and his mastery of perspective is insane!

 

Kenneth Anderson:  Kenneth is a professional character designer and illustrator based in the UK, whos forte is vikings, pirates and...welll...everything :) You'll learn tons of tricks from his superhuman skills in character based illustration and design! 

 

Book Details

If you've backed our projects before then you know that we always use premium materials for our books. We believe that books are an artform in themselves and the presentation of the content is just as important as the content itself! In an age where reading has moved online, we want to bring back the physical feelings you get from holding a new, clean, crisp printed book in your hands, savouring every page.

 Stretch Goals

Stretch Goal 1: $135,000 (SEK 1,270,000): You get an awesome 4 Hour Character Design VIDEO Course! UNLOCKED!

Stretch Goal 2: $145,000 (SEK 1,365,000): You get a new artist in the book! We got some great suggestions for artists from you already and we're already contacting them :) But feel free to leave more suggestions in the comments section. It's always fun to hear who you guys like! UNLOCKED!

Stretch Goal 3: $155,000 (SEK 1,460,000): You get an awesome PREMIUM ART PRINT in the book, with art from one of our artists. We will choose the print after the kickstarter! :) Due to insane shipping costs, we can only offer this if you got the printed book. It will ship together with the book.

Stretch Goal 4:  COMING SOON! :)

 

More Incredible Artists!

Wouter Tulp: Wouter Tulp is a master storyteller, who has an instantly recognizable style. He worked on our very first book in 2014 and now he's back. In Wouter you'll get a seasoned pro whos passion and excitment are conveyed through his outstanding tutorials and designs. He's incredibly busy, so we're absolutely delighted he could get involved again!

 

CHAMBA: Jeffrey Cruz (AKA Chamba) loves drawing! And we love his drawings, especially when he draws in our books :) Chamba is a highly sought after artists who has worked for Marvel, D.C, Udon Capcom and Disney. He's also worked on our previous books and we can't wait for his new contribution!

 

Michael Bills: Michael is an incredbile concept artist with a really unique style. We've been working with him for a long time and he always provides exciting and fun contributions! His impressive character design abilities make him a real treasure on this project.  

 

 

Rodgon: A gallon of life, a liter of cute and a twist of perv! Rodgon is an insanely talented artist who we're working with for the first time. There's a cool story about how we met, but we'll leave that for another time :) In the meantime, enjoy some of his crazy, unique skecthes. Bet you've never seen a post it like that before!

 

Genzoman: AKA Gonzalo Ordonez Arias is a exceptional illustrator and fantasy painter whose impressive work makes anyone’s eyes cling to their screen. Well known for his work on World of Warcraft, his talents are a real asset to this project!

Our Artists have worked for these folks!

 

Learn about our previous books below...

We have limited copies of our second book, Illustrator's Guidebok , availabe in the upper teirs of the rewards. You can find some brief informaton about the book below.

 

Illustrator's Guidebook is our second crowdfunded book. It is a broader book that touches on the many aspects of what it means to be an illustrator, including figure drawing, anatomy, environment design, perspective, coloring, character design and more!

Who is 21 Draw?

We are a group of international artists with headquarters in Sweden and main operations in the US, UK and EU. Our experience from our last projects means we have a great logistics system in place, so we can get your book to you as quickly as possible.

Guarantee! 

We're so sure that you'll love this book, that we offer you a 100% money back guarantee. If you don't love every page of the book, you can get a refund after 30 days from the date when you receive it. 

 

Backers are Best!

Our backers are the engnie that drives us to continue creating books and other projects. Our products simply would never exist if it was not for YOU. Back in 2014 you helped us create our very first book. Then in 2016 you helped us create our second book, Illustrator's Guidebook. 

You didn't only help fund the projects, but you also gave us the ideas for them. We have an amazing community of backers, and we've even met many of you "in real life" :) We'll continue to make products for you as long as you keep telling us what you want. A big THANK YOU!!! to everyone who has backed the project, and a massive thanks to all of you who spread the word!
story_txt: A Brand NEW book!In 2014 and 2016, Indiegogo and Kickstarter helped us raise over $400,000 for our first two books. We're back with a TOTALLY BRAND NEW BOOK filled with more artists, more excitement and more fun! We've been working hard since January 2018, and we hope YOU love it!  Praise for 21 Draw...Steve Rude - "An excellent guide from a stunning variety of top-notch artists. You will gain much from its study."Loopy Dave - "The lineup is fantastic - full of artists who's work I admire. Very excited to be part of this new book!"Charlie Bowater - "I loved the first book and this one is shaping up to be even better!" Lorenzo Etherington - "The new 21 Draw book will delve even deeper than the last in a collection of incredible process tutorials from the world's greatest artists."Warren Louw - "The lineup of talent in 21 Draw is awesome! "21 Draw as seen on... About the Book... Ever since our first book back in 2014, our backers, fans and students have been asking us for a "how-to" book that is focused purely on character design. Our first 2 books touched briefly on the character design process, but this new book is a really deep dive into the art. Character design is such a vast field, which is why it needs it's own focused, indepth book. We're working with an amazing line up of incredible industry PROFESSIONALS, and the book is jam-packed full of their combined experience, gained over their long careers. Design Example - Unofficial CoverDesign Example - "Character Archetypes" Chapter The Goal! Our goal is to help YOU be a better artist and have fun at the same time! We want to provide you,  both hobbyists and pros, with a better understanding of the WHOLE character design process. Most importantly, the book gives you the tools you need to produce unique and memorable characters. The techniques and tutorials included in the book help build your confidence and strengthen your knowledge of the art of character design, enabling you to successfully design for any project, and most importantly, in any style. And that's why we have such a wide array of artists with varying styles contributing to book! This is a book that we have dreamed of making for a long time and it is our biggest project to date. We're making a book that you'll love and cherish for your whole drawing career. YOU will love every page or else you'll get your money back! That's our promise to you."Gesture" Chapter"Breaking the Rules" Chapter Meet our artists!LOISH: Lois Van Barrle (AKA Loish) is one of our favourite artists! She's an incredibly talented digital artist with a unique, dream-like style, and you're sure to have seen her work before. Loish has been working with us since 2014 and she always provides amazing work. We're so excited to have her on board again!Loish!Awesome Loish! Tom Bancroft: Tom is a Disney Legend who's been involved in every single project we've done! He's worked on classics like Beauty & the Beast, Lion King & Alladin. His books like "Character Mentor" & others are required reading for many artschools in the world. So cool that he's up for another project :)Tom Bancroft!Tom Bancroft Loopy Dave: Dave is another superb artist that we've been working with for a long time. He has an instantly recognizable style, and always contributes incredible, unique (and funny!) tutorials.Loopy Dave Part of Loopy Dave's artwork for our 1st book back in 2014! Rene Cordova:  Rene is an incredibly talented character designer, art director and illustrator that we're working with for the first time. He's widely known in the industry, with an army of adoring fans! He has so many styles that it's impossible to even describe!Rene Cordova! Rene Cordova Gerardo Sandoval:  Gerardo is a kick ass Mexican artist that we've also been working with since 2014. He currently draws for Marvel Comics and other big names. He always provides amazing contributions and his mastery of perspective is insane!Gerardo Sandoval Kenneth Anderson:  Kenneth is a professional character designer and illustrator based in the UK, whos forte is vikings, pirates and...welll...everything :) You'll learn tons of tricks from his superhuman skills in character based illustration and design! Kenneth Anderson Kenneth's "Undead Pirate" tutorial for our last project.Book DetailsIf you've backed our projects before then you know that we always use premium materials for our books. We believe that books are an artform in themselves and the presentation of the content is just as important as the content itself! In an age where reading has moved online, we want to bring back the physical feelings you get from holding a new, clean, crisp printed book in your hands, savouring every page."Character Archetype" Chapter"The Tools" Chapter Stretch GoalsStretch Goal 1: $135,000 (SEK 1,270,000): You get an awesome 4 Hour Character Design VIDEO Course! UNLOCKED!Stretch Goal 2: $145,000 (SEK 1,365,000): You get a new artist in the book! We got some great suggestions for artists from you already and we're already contacting them :) But feel free to leave more suggestions in the comments section. It's always fun to hear who you guys like! UNLOCKED!Stretch Goal 3: $155,000 (SEK 1,460,000): You get an awesome PREMIUM ART PRINT in the book, with art from one of our artists. We will choose the print after the kickstarter! :) Due to insane shipping costs, we can only offer this if you got the printed book. It will ship together with the book.Stretch Goal 4:  COMING SOON! :)  More Incredible Artists!Wouter Tulp: Wouter Tulp is a master storyteller, who has an instantly recognizable style. He worked on our very first book in 2014 and now he's back. In Wouter you'll get a seasoned pro whos passion and excitment are conveyed through his outstanding tutorials and designs. He's incredibly busy, so we're absolutely delighted he could get involved again!Wouter TulpWouter Tulp CHAMBA: Jeffrey Cruz (AKA Chamba) loves drawing! And we love his drawings, especially when he draws in our books :) Chamba is a highly sought after artists who has worked for Marvel, D.C, Udon Capcom and Disney. His impressive character design abilities make him a real treasure on this project.   Michael Bills Rodgon: A gallon of life, a liter of cute and a twist of perv! story:
What is it? 
Basically, I will design and create at least 3 cast-in-mold concrete fountains that will incorporate water movement and sound in the design. Something that creates a visual centerpiece for meditation, or a soothing background ambiance for a work space or relaxation at home I say '3 or more' because this project is 3, but if it goes well and I have additional materials left over, I will make additional pieces while I am on a roll! If the project goes well, I’d like to try and incorporate light into  future versions of this project too! 


Why are you interested in concrete, Mr Metalsmith? 
I have always been interested in sculpture, even while pushing into the jewelry and craft field. Usually anything with moving, changing bits and bobs that are influenced by nature, be it wind or water, will catch my eye. I am also very interested in the way light interacts with water and other materials. Well, it's been enough looking, time to get into it myself! 

On top of that, I find the concept of center-piece meditation, during which a practitioner has an object to focus on, to be very appealing. I think that water features have a very primal connectivity to human thought and that they can function very effectively in this regard. Even the light babbling of a small waterfall in your living room can have an amazing effect!


Gimmie Specifics... 
For this project, I’d like to explore the amazingly versatile cast-in-place concrete methods I keep seeing and hearing about. They show up in home remodels, kitchen counters, and gardens. I want to do so within an area of sculptural interest for myself, so I chose fountains because I love the ambiance that moving, trickling, splashing water can create. I spend as much time as I can in the wilderness by rivers and streams and the ocean and the power of water is astounding. I want to bring this experience, even if in a small way, into the home. 

I am going to make three  'in home' sized fountains. Which amounts to about 1ft (30cm) by 2 ft (61cm) by 1.5ft (45cm). This is the general size, as some of the designs are shorter, or taller, skinnier, or longer. All in all, they'll encompass the same physical presence when functioning.

In-home fountains are nothing new, hell, the Greeks had them. But I think everything can be re-defined in a new aesthetic quality and I hope you enjoy my take on a timeless concept. 


Why Concrete? 
I find concrete to be a fascinating material. We've all, mostly, sat in the mud as a kid and packed it together, made sand castles, or pushed dirt around. But it is very temporary and never seems to last. Concrete, or more specifically mortar mix in this case, functions nearly the same way but after the water leaves, it is solid and stable! I love the idea of low cost materials (coming from Jewelry experience!) that can be so mold-able  I look forward to another dialog with a new material.

click the image for more



Those look weird, what is the process? 
Basically, the process is pretty simple. I will create mold forms out of Styrofoam sheet, duct tape, hot glue, and whatever else necessary to create the shape of the sculpture fountains. This will also include any cast-in-place structural bits I might need such as bars to maintain negative space, wood or metal feet to the bottom, and any aesthetic items that will be permanently fixed into the cement. 

From there I will mix the mortar mix with the possible addition of nylon fibers for strength and pour it into the molds. Since I have to use more water to get a pour-able consistency, the molds will have to stay in place for at least 2-3 days before I can remove them. If we were in a less-humid climate, I could get away with less, but as I found with my color samples, they can be a tad crumbly if you aren't patient!
  
Once the cement is fully cured and dried I will be able to do finishing to the surface texture using sand paper and buffing wheels, add dyes, and seal the inside surfaces with polyurethane to minimize wear on the cement by the moving water.

Finishing touches such as stone filler (black rocks are sooo cool!) and installing the pumps will complete the process! 

For more detail photos of the prototype, check out my supplemental page here! 



How will the project evolve afterwards? 
While this isn't a direct part of the project, it is exciting none the less. Once the project is finished, I will be left with at least 3 fountains that are aesthetically cohesive! I am excited to get into sculpture and gallery art, and I think I might be able to use these fountains for gallery application and submission processes in Portland Oregon! So by helping me with this project, you are giving me more things to play with as I establish my artistic world!

click the image for more


How can I help you, Mr. Penniless Sitar Player? 
Art isn’t free, unfortunately, or I’d spend countless days in my studio working on new designs. I have been running a small metal-art business for a few years now and the economy is not ideal. I have wanted to break into this new medium, but have lacked the expendable income to do so. By supporting my project, I will finally have the start-up experience needed to express at least a few of the dozens and dozens of sketches I have done over the years. And the resulting finished project will fuel my exploration of a new medium that can go towards MORE projects! 

By backing my project, you are making this dream a reality and giving me a head start, and that is priceless!

What makes you think you're good enough? 
Basically I am a serial craftsman. Be it art, structure, food, functional, or decorative, I can’t get enough of making things with my hands! I am a bit of a jack-of-all trades. 

I have my roots in a wide range of skills ranging anywhere from: 
jewelry fabrication and design 
knifemaking, 
wilderness survival, 
camping and homesteading, 
Sewing, 
cooking, 
martial arts, 
wood working, 
bone carving, 
and a bunch of other odds and ends. 

Turns out I love to learn and I retain information well when I can get my hands in on the work. 

More specifically for this project, I have done a fair bit of cement and concrete work in construction settings, helping with odd jobs. I have even worked with limecrete in Wales on an eco-house! Plus, I have a prototype fountain that is 3 feet tall, albeit a bit ugly. I have done some basic work in acid-washing cement, and I am excited to refine all of this into the next level of concrete work.

click the image for more


Special Thanks to... 
I went over to West Side Concrete's Hillsboro branch to talk with Brandon Russell about logistics and dyes. He was a huge help. I will also be getting most of my materials at West Side Concrete once the project succeeds. Thanks guys! Head into the store or check them out athttp://www.westconacc.com/ 

Thanks to my buddy Mike Chastain for filming and editing my video, his camera is much nicer than mine and he's a smart cookie ;) 


Photos! 
In addition to the photos below, you can see more in progress and reward item photos by clicking here! 

Backer Rewards! 

Bamboo Earrings,

click the image for more

Hand shaped Wooden pendants

click the image for more

Hand shaped Bone pendants! 

click the image for more

Brass Earrings 

click the image for more

Knife #1, spear point! 

click the image for more

Knife #2, Hunter's Skinner! 

click the image for more



Knife #3, Ranger's Belt Knife!

click the image for more

Mini-Sculpture Reward Design Sketches 

click the image for more
click the image for more
 
First prototype desk sculpture from my designs.
click the image for more


For more details, check the FAQ or submit your own questions! 

Thank you for Kickstarting my project!

story:
Our Goal:

To complete a large scale work of public art, a granite fountain designed by award winning local sculptor Justin Blowers. Upon completion, the fountain will be presented as a gift to the Citizens of Asheville, NC. The centerpiece for the fountain, a regal six foot tall granite sculpture, has already been donated to the project by Justin. We need your help to build the rest of it!



Helping Our City:

Asheville citizens are well known for our enduring love of the arts, a fact that is made evident simply by walking through town. By raising our own money directly, rather than relying on the limited tax funds available for public art, we as citizens are not just further beautifying our home, but also assisting our Public Art and Cultural Commission in their recent efforts to direct resources towards the maintenance and upkeep of older existing public landmarks. The fountain will exist as a testament to the citizens who choose to support it's creation. Even before completion, the already finished centerpiece represents an asset valued at approximately $10,000, with no initial expense to the tax payer. Every effort in the construction of the fountain will be made with the goal of minimizing operating and maintenance costs wherever possible.


Needed Materials and Rewards for Patrons:

We want to show everybody how much you love art, and how much you love Asheville!


We also understand that not everyone has the resources to make major contributions--but that doesn't make your appreciation worth any less!


Therefore every contributor, no matter how small the donation, will be credited as a patron of the project on the artist's website, at http://justinblowers.com   (Higher level contributors can choose from the rewards listed to the right!)

 

The more funds we raise, the more we can accomplish! Here are the steps necessary to complete the fountain:


We will need to purchase over 192 square ft. of polished granite to complete the walls of the basin, which will measure 10 feet wide x 6 feet deep, and stand approximately 2 feet high. The basin walls will also double as benches. The granite will need to be cut on a large gantry saw, polished on all exposed edges, and then transported to Justin's studio to engrave the names of everyone who donates to the project. Funds will also be used to secure storage for the completed fountain while a suitable location is chosen. If we exceed our goal, we may be able to explore the use of solar powered pumps to operate the fountain, and set aside funds to put towards the cost of installation. The walls and centerpiece will then be assembled on a reinforced concrete slab on the chosen location, along with connections for electricity and water.


Even if we do not reach or exceed our financial goal by the end of this first campaign, the project will still continue, and all contributors will still be credited and rewarded. Location and installation will be based on the future recommendations of an established local committee. All contributors will be updated via e-mail on our progress at each major stage of development. Please note that the location and installation process may take several months to complete. Thank you for your support!

story:
Hello, my name is Mykel, I'm an artist and the co-owner of Cute 'n' Deadly with my boyfriend Josh. We started this around October 2011 to fulfill my dream of selling my own merchandise. Since then, we've sold everything from notebooks, charms, buttons, shirts, and anything else we can think of. I feel as if plushies are the next step, and I would love to be able to get them done! I go to anime conventions in Oklahoma, I'd like to branch out and do other states too. Texas would be my first destination!

The plushies would really mean a lot to me to get because I want Teru to be an offical mascot of our company, Cute 'n' Deadly. Our shop focuses on unique items that are both cute, but also not the girl's "filled with pink and glitter" kind. As a girl, I know how hard it is to find cute things that are also not girly. I love things of the "gothic" nature, and I know a lot of my friends are the same way. But we just have such a hard time finding things that are both cute the way we like it, but also afforable.

So that is the purpose of our shop. We want to make cute items that are a bit on the gothic side, but still have them at a really nice price so that anyone could afford them. I think Teru is a perfect example of our goal.

story:
I am an artist seeking funds to create truly outrageous multimedia work about women and adornment for an exhibit in London this fall called Dare to Wear, curated by Sue Kreitzman.

The funds are for art supplies and electronics, to transport the work properly, and to get myself to England to install the work and be at the opening.

These multi media pieces are about the unabashed love women have for adornment. Women and jewelry are inseparable in these pieces. The women are made from beads and sequins, they are wearing jewelry and the jewelry contains their video images. They wear video necklaces and iPod crowns.  The work is both high and low tech, frivolous and filled with layers of meaning and expressions of female identity.  I am working on new pieces, including wearable video necklaces up until I get on the plane.

To see the works in progress and some of my previous art, please check out quimettadarestowear.blogspot.com

By supporting my project, you are supporting an artist to do her work and further her career, and of course, spread the joy of over-the-top art throughout the northern hemisphere.  But there is something else in it for you!  There are perks!  I really see this as a barter system… depending on how much you contribute, you will receive a small or larger archival inkjet print related to these themes or a piece of wearable art, or an original mixed media piece, even possibly a video necklace.

Please share this campaign with friends.

Thank you.

story:
Who Is Gold & Apel?

I'm Elsa Briggs, an artist and jewelry maker.

My art reflects themes of mystery, seduction, love & lust. I prefer portraits but also enjoy botanical studies. My jewelry is inspired by the Victorian era and the Art Nouveau & Art Deco movements.

I am relaunching my company, Gold & Apel, and want to take it to the national stage at the Bayou City Art Festival (BCAF) in March 2013. This is one of the top ten art festivals in the United States and you must apply at least 6 months in advance to exhibit there.

Exhibiting at the BCAF has been one of my big artistic dreams, but the costs associated with setting up my booth (part of the application process is a photo of your booth with all your art set up in it) and also producing enough art and jewelry to fill a 10'x10' booth for a high-volume sales show like BCAF have been prohibitive.

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for $6000 for the following expenses:
* my booth and displays ($1500);
* my application & entry fees to Bayou City ($500);
* limited edition giclee prints of my artwork ($750);
* promotional materials ($500);
* classes and workshops for jewelry-makers ($750);
* bulk wholesale orders of art & jewelry supplies ($1600); and
* packaging supplies for my online & market sales ($400).


Any additional amount that I raise will go towards upgrading my booth, more prints, more supplies & more entries into local & regional markets.

I've chosen flexible funding meaning I receive all the money that is contributed because every little bit will help me get closer to showing at BCAF.

If I don't raise the full amount, I will spend the money contributed in the order listed above.

Rewards

We're offering up a Thank You photo from the Briggs family, magnets, signed prints, exclusive jewelry, assemblage sculptures and custom artwork. Please see the sidebar for details.

The Impact

Contributing to my campaign will help me fulfill my ultimate dream as an artist to be totally independent and not need two jobs (like I work now). I seek to make art full-time and make enough money to pay myself what I deserve and need to live freely, re-invest in my company, and give back to the community.

After exhibiting once in BCAF, I will received preferred registration for future festivals and adding multiple years at BCAF to my artistic credentials will be huge in building my name.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money, please contribute a few seconds by using the IndieGoGo share tools to spread the word about my campaign. The more people that hear about me and my art, the better a chance I have of meeting my goal.

Thanks so much!

<3 Elsa

story:
“RÉCHAUFFEMENT”

An installation conceived for UNESCO ‘s Garden, Paris, France.

Rafael de Pool presents "réchauffement", an installation in which each letter of the title is comprised of frozen water that correspond to the 13 most polluted rivers on the planet. A powerful metaphor that amplifies and freezes the issues of ‘global warming’ and ‘pollution of waterways’ in time, thus, inviting the viewer to reflect on these issues as part of the problem and part of the solution.

The artist envisions these landscapes and its degradation as his primary source of inspiration. He models after the poetry contained in nature and assembles an eloquent installation by crystallizing the ‘cruel environmental reality’ and the excessive pollution that is slowly killing the main rivers of the planet. 

Humans are mainly comprised of water, therefore, rivers are vital and powerful links, fingerprints traced as paths on the ground. They determine the identity and activity of all the species that inhabit them.

In classical Chinese poetry rivers were deeply treasured and during Europe’s ‘Romantic Era’ they were sublimed. They are symbols of purity and viewed as instruments to float adrift. Its meandering course furrows the earth while being impregnated with minerals and salts, reconnecting with us, like the human bloodstream.

What would we feel if we realize that the blood that irrigates that land is poisoned? It sends chills down my spine. Awareness is what Rafael De Pool’s work is centered on.

The pollution of these thirteen rivers, which span across 5 continents: (Salween, Danube, Rio de La Plata, Rio Grande, Ganges, Indus, Nile, Murray-Darling, Mekong, Yangtze, Citarum, Amazon, Orinoco) is increased by global warming and it is drifting humanity towards a dreadful landscape. Rafael De Pool has endeavored to describe it with ice ... we must act quickly!

Elisa Rodríguez Campo @elisarodriguezc (Curator)

See Rafael's work at: www.rafaeldepool.com

See interview at RFI Español with Jordi Batallé (in spanish): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sH6JiSlyj64

Documentary on Rafael De Pool and his work by Cesar Cortez (in spanish): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dHHSb29cPKk

Rafael De Pool's biography:

Rafael de Pool was born in Caracas, Venezuela (1963). He currently resides in the city of Paris where he continues to develop his creativity and expand his artistic vision.

He studied fine arts in Venezuela and participated in many individual and collective exhibitions in numerous museums and galleries around the country like the: National Art Gallery, Museum of Contemporary Art in Caracas, Museum of Contemporary Art in Aragua, Salon Aragua, Museum of Contemporary Art "Mario Abreu" in Maracay. He was also part of various international exhibits in Budapest, Paris, Belgium, Geneva, Italy and United Kingdom. 

Since his early days as an artist Rafael de Pool’s work has been consistently linked to the preservation of the environment and the protection of endangered animal species. He has coined the term “Eco-cinetism” to describe his work and continues to develop a wide array of artistic facets that range from installations, engraving, painting, sculpture and drawing. 

He has received many distinguished awards in his home country of Venezuela. He received the “Premio Nacional de Escultura” award in the Salón Aragua, Venezuela and the “Gran Premio de La Bienal de Bellas Artes” award in Lima, Perú. 

You can also find us on the ArtCOP21 website: http://www.artcop21.com/fr/events/rechauffement/

story:
What's a Meownge You Ask?

The Meownge is a cat-themed camp debuting this year at Burning Man. Using props, costumes, and camp kittehs (facilitators) to help bring out your inner feline, The Meownge invites you to dance, yowl, and shake off those fleas of everyday life! So why do we have an Indiegogo campaign? The headpiece of our camp will be a 14-foot, 10,000-LED interactive cat head, wrapped in 400 square feet of Lyrca, and sporting such features as an interior chill area and interactive eyes. We have the human resources to pull this off but, since the materials are not cheap, the Meownge's largest art piece needs YOU to become a reality!

***To be clear, the money raised via this campaign will go solely to the creation of the cat head and will not go towards any camp expenses in any way.***

 

Feel Good About Your Donation - A Special Partnership with Cat Town Oakland

We’re partnering with Cat Town to help our feline friends here in Oakland, California. By supporting the Meownge you’re also contributing to helping, shy, senior and other at-risk cats find a home outside of the shelter. Cat Town has helped reduce the euthanasia rates for cats from 42% in 2011 to 14% today. Contributing to the Meownge means that you help lower that number even more. 

Where's My Money Going?

We need your support to bring the Meownge to life! We’ve invested over $2500 of our own funds to get this project started. Now we need your help getting this art piece lit up, covered, out of our studio and into the world. We'll also be building a wooden base that will double as a comfortable lounge, or as we prefer to say, Meownge

Here's exactly what we need:

10,000 LEDs - $1000

Two tracking spot lights for eyes - $600

Xbox Kinect - $100

Rasberry Pi + DMX Converter - $200

LED encasing to diffuse the lights - $400

One solar panel to charge batteries - $200

Two batteries to power lights - $550

Fabric for cover - $500

Wood for interior structure + Seating Area - $1000

Interior Padding - $450

Trailer rental to get the Meownge to the Playa  - $400

Hammocks and interior decor for ultimate meowngeing - $600

Cat Town Donation - $1000

***Any money we raise outside of our goal will go towards making the Meownge mobile for future burn's and supporting Cat Town!

What You'll Get in Return

Everyone who donates will have their name displayed on one very special piece of the Meownge. Imagine that, your name will live on with the Meownge legacy always and furrever!

Receive a personal postcard from the playa. We'll be creating Meownge inspired postcards to send to you from our playground in the dust.

Stickers - Personalize your favorite items with these UV coated, weatherproof stickers. 

Flashy, Blinky Cat Ears - These cat ear headbands are our favorite kitty accessories. Powered by 4 lithium button batteries they're light, comfortable and will keep you lit up all night.

Meownge T-shirt - Sport your love of cats with this limited edition t-shirt designed by one of our talented artists.

Custom Art - For those capable of donating larger funds you will be rewarded with your choice of a custom pet portrait or a self portrait of your spirit animal. Don’t have a pet and have no idea what your spirit animal is? Not to worry! Let us take you on a spiritual journey via Skype to help you discover your other animalistic self.

How Else Can You Help? 

If you can’t afford a monetary donation not to worry. There’s plenty you can do to help! Sharing our campaign with your community will definitely help us reach our goal. Get the word out and please repost our fundraiser over your social media platforms. Sending your friends an email about our cause is also a great way to make a more personal gesture. By helping the Meownge you’re supporting a large scale art project and giving at-risk cats a chance of finding a very much needed home and family.

Our Challenges + Progress

Building the Meownge is full of challenges. We’re constantly being tested with technical problems in our build. Thankfully, we’ve started our process early and are equipped with a solid group of engineers, designers, mathematicians, seamstresses and artists to help see this through. We continue to work through our challenges with creative and analytical problem solving. We’re using CAD programs, coding, and countless hours of research from our core team to see that this project is completed for Burning Man.

The First Sketch⬇

The Second Attempt  ⬇ 

Back to the drawing boards! This time with Chris David's help.⬇

Chris David bringing our vision to the next level!⬇

From rendering to paper prototyping  ⬇

From paper prototype to wooden prototype with rubber tube joints... Getting closer ⬇

From all the prototypes to the real deal! Made out of conduit and love, sweat, and tears.⬇Now we have to cover it, light it up and build the wooden frame for tiered seating and lounging.

 

Meet Some of Our Amazing Team...

Dan Simmons - Creative Lead + Builder

As a toddler I was always tinkering with everyday mundane objects. I would take things apart, trying to understand their functionality and transforming them into fun toys. That sense of creation, exploration and wonder has never left me. During the day you will find me working as a commercial photographer. By night I become a mad scientist creating, in this case, a 14 foot cat head. Watching the Meownge progress is like walking into a Willy Wonka chocolate factory. Having my family and friends, old and new, partake in creating something of this scale is beyond amazing. Being able to teach and be taught is what makes this project so enjoyable. I can't wait to see this sculpture on the playa and watch as it illuminates smiles on all your faces. I hope that the Meownge will inspire you to want to create something bigger than yourself. Reach for the impossible and be surprised!

 

Hanna Simmons - Co-Creator, Producer

I have always practiced some form of visual art, whether it be large scale painting, installation art, design or product development. It is important for me to be creating work that impacts the human experience and stimulates imaginative and playful spaces. In 2011, I participated in the build of a 30 foot metal based pyramid for Harvest Festival in Burk’s Falls, Canada. Working on the pyramid has given me the base knowledge and first hand experience to bring a 14 foot geometric pussy to life! I’m so excited to be part of creating the Meownge and giving you the purrrrrfect space to play in.

 

Christopher David - Industrial Designer

Hi! I am Chris, an enthusiastic 20 something year old with the passion for automobiles, design & creating massive cat heads. I can be found exploring my home of San Francisco with a sketchbook in hand and a strong coffee in the other. Outside of the studio you will find me riding my bike over the Golden Gate Bridge or driving down the Pacific Coast Highway to my hometown of Santa Cruz. Wherever I go I stay close to my designer heart, observing  and analysing, helping to create a brighter future with fun, utilitarian products.

 

Jared Mednick - Illumination Engineer

I’ve been interested in making a major contribution using my skills to Burning Man for a long while.  Personally, I come from an engineering background and I love making cool shit!  The Playa leaves an impression on me through the melding and mixing of creative and practical pursuits that manifests itself into Playa Art.  I’ve been helping to herd this group of cats for a while now and am super stoked to see us giving back to the playa in a major way!  

 

Tara Simmons - Community Outreach

I am a fun loving, pickling, welding, Oakland chick who loves to throw a good party. My role within the Meownge is to help build the structure and FUNdraise! My 9-5 has me sitting at a desk assisting a team of bankers but my passion outside of the office is connecting with people and showing everyone how fun life can by co-ordinating special events. For the Meownge, I am working alongside a team of strong-willed and talented individuals that are putting together fundraisers across the Bay Area to help cover some of the costs of the Meownge.

 

Mike Halliday - Assistant Builder

Hi, my name is Mike Halliday, I live in Oakland, CA and I'm helping to bring the Meownge to Burning Man. Working in finance, I like to spend my free time away from the office, contributing and creating art. When Dan and Hanna approached me with the opportunity to help build a 14' cat head, I was instantly sold. Since then, with the help of a diverse group of Kittehs, skillful volunteers, and a supportive community, I have been spending the previous months cutting, flattening, drilling, sculpting and creating the Meownge. I hope you get to experience it for yourself.....meow

 

Thank you so much for your support! We are so thrilled to bring this special project into the world and appreciate all your help. We can't do this with you!

I am Chris, an enthusiastic 20 something year old with the passion for automobiles, design & creating massive cat heads. I can be found exploring my home of San Francisco with a sketchbook in hand and a strong coffee in the other. Outside of the studio you will find me riding my bike over the Golden Gate Bridge or driving down the Pacific Coast Highway to my hometown of Santa Cruz. Wherever I go I stay close to my designer heart, observing  and analysing, helping to create a brighter future with fun, utilitarian products. Jared Mednick - Illumination EngineerI’ve been interested in making a major contribution using my skills to Burning Man for a long while.  Personally, I come from an engineering background and I love making cool shit!  The Playa leaves an impression on me through the melding and mixing of creative and practical pursuits that manifests itself into Playa Art.  I’ve been helping to herd this group of cats for a while now and am super stoked to see us giving back to the playa in a major way!   Tara Simmons - Community OutreachI am a fun loving, pickling, welding, Oakland chick who loves to throw a good party. My role within the Meownge is to help build the structure and FUNdraise! My 9-5 has me sitting at a desk assisting a team of bankers but my passion outside of the office is connecting with people and showing everyone how fun life can by co-ordinating special events. For the Meownge, I am working alongside a team of strong-willed and talented individuals that are putting together fundraisers across the Bay Area to help cover some of the costs of the Meownge. Mike Halliday - Assistant BuilderHi, my name is Mike Halliday, I live in Oakland, CA and I'm helping to bring the Meownge to Burning Man. Working in finance, I like to spend my free time away from the office, contributing and creating art. When Dan and Hanna approached me with the opportunity to help build a 14' cat head, I was instantly sold. Since then, with the help of a diverse group of Kittehs, skillful volunteers, and a supportive community, I have been spending the previous months cutting, flattening, drilling, sculpting and creating the Meownge. I hope you get to experience it for yourself.....meow
